page.title: 06FORESTRY
page.content: Buccleuch Estates workshop, Eckford Mill employ 2 foresters. Wooden Hill, 48ha. the largest afforested area of the total 105 is chiefly conifers. Norway Spruce are planted in plots and are ready to retail as xmas trees at 6 year old. Larchwood converts to fencing whilst Scots Pine, Douglas Fir Sitka Spruce and Grand Fir go to the building trade. The wood below 15cm. diam. is cut into 2m lengths and sent to chipboard or pulp mills. Oak, Beech and Sycamore are planted in Spring and when matured sold to timber merchants for furniture and boat building, the offcuts becoming firewood. Other hard woods grown in the area are Ash, Elm, Wild Cherry, Hawthorn, Elder, Crab Apple, Chestnut, Maple, Willow, Holly, Popular and Silver Birch.
